title: Bug 116744: Dynamic text content type has no effect
OB: When the dynamic text element's Content Type property is set to Auto, Plain, or HTML, the report always displays the same results. The content is not being displayed as expected.
EB:
I expect the report to display different results based on the dynamic text element's Content Type property. 
For Plain, I expect the literal content (tags and all) to be displayed. 
For Auto, I expect the content to appear properly without HTML or RTF tags. 
For HTML, I expect specific content to appear properly without HTML tags, and other content to appear literally with RTF tags.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Open the attached report. 
2. Set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Plain. 
3. Verify that the literal content is displayed, including any tags present. 
4. Set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to Auto. 
5. Verify that all the content appears properly without HTML or RTF tags. 
6. Set the dynamic text element's Content Type property to HTML. 
7. Verify that specific content appears properly without HTML tags, and other content appears literally with RTF tags.
